input.description: XML document conforming to the Connection Details Concept that contains the information required to execute a command via command line
The target network or host address.
Indicates whether the target is a network or host address. Valid values: net, host.
The gateway to which packets will be routed.
The name of the interface from which packets will be routed.

output.description: XML document consisting of one or more <line> elements that contain the command response. Each <line> element contains an index attribute indicating the order in which the information was returned by the command.
Did the operation Succeed? Valid value: true.
Did the operation Succeed? Valid value: true.

xslt-stylesheet.stylesheet: <xsl:stylesheet xmlns:xsl="http://www.w3.org/1999/XSL/Transform" version="1.0"> <xsl:output indent="yes" /> <xsl:template match="/"> <fat-command> <command os-id="Linux"> <xsl:text>/sbin/route del</xsl:text> <xsl:choose> <xsl:when test="'net'='${target type}'"> <xsl:text disable-output-escaping="no"> -net</xsl:text> </xsl:when> <xsl:otherwise> <xsl:text disable-output-escaping="no"> -host</xsl:text> </xsl:otherwise> </xsl:choose> <xsl:text disable-output-escaping="no"> ${target}</xsl:text> <xsl:if test="string-length('${netmask}')!=0"> <xsl:text> netmask ${netmask}</xsl:text> </xsl:if> <xsl:text disable-output-escaping="no"> gw ${gateway}</xsl:text> <xsl:if test="string-length('${metric}')!=0"> <xsl:text> metric ${metric}</xsl:text> </xsl:if> <xsl:if test="string-length('${interface}')!=0"> <xsl:text> dev ${interface}</xsl:text> </xsl:if> </command> </fat-command> </xsl:template> </xsl:stylesheet>

<xsl:stylesheet xmlns:xsl="http://www.w3.org/1999/XSL/Transform" version="1.0"> <xsl:output indent="yes" /> <xsl:template match="/"> <fat-command> <command os-id="Windows Default"> <xsl:text>route change</xsl:text> <xsl:text disable-output-escaping="no"> ${target}</xsl:text> <xsl:if test="string-length('${netmask}')!=0"> <xsl:text> mask ${netmask}</xsl:text> </xsl:if> <xsl:text disable-output-escaping="no"> ${gateway}</xsl:text> <xsl:if test="string-length('${metric}')!=0"> <xsl:text> metric ${metric}</xsl:text> </xsl:if> <xsl:if test="string-length('${interface}')!=0"> <xsl:text> dev ${interface}</xsl:text> </xsl:if> </command> <command os-id="Linux"> <xsl:text>/sbin/route add</xsl:text> <xsl:choose> <xsl:when test="'net'='${target type}'"> <xsl:text disable-output-escaping="no"> -net</xsl:text> </xsl:when> <xsl:otherwise> <xsl:text disable-output-escaping="no"> -host</xsl:text> </xsl:otherwise> </xsl:choose> <xsl:text disable-output-escaping="no"> ${target}</xsl:text> <xsl:if test="string-length('${netmask}')!=0"> <xsl:text> netmask ${netmask}</xsl:text> </xsl:if> <xsl:text disable-output-escaping="no"> gw ${gateway}</xsl:text> <xsl:if test="string-length('${metric}')!=0"> <xsl:text> metric ${metric}</xsl:text> </xsl:if> <xsl:if test="string-length('${interface}')!=0"> <xsl:text> dev ${interface}</xsl:text> </xsl:if> </command> <command os-id="SunOS"> <xsl:text>/usr/sbin/route change</xsl:text> <xsl:choose> <xsl:when test="'net'='${target type}'"> <xsl:text disable-output-escaping="no"> -net</xsl:text> </xsl:when> <xsl:otherwise> <xsl:text disable-output-escaping="no"> -host</xsl:text> </xsl:otherwise> </xsl:choose> <xsl:text disable-output-escaping="no"> ${target}</xsl:text> <xsl:if test="string-length('${netmask}')!=0"> <xsl:text> -netmask ${netmask}</xsl:text> </xsl:if> <xsl:text disable-output-escaping="no"> ${gateway}</xsl:text> <xsl:if test="string-length('${metric}')!=0"> <xsl:text disable-output-escaping="no"> ${metric}</xsl:text> </xsl:if> <xsl:if test="string-length('${interface}')!=0"> <xsl:text> -interface ${interface}</xsl:text> </xsl:if> </command> <xsl:text> </xsl:text> </fat-command> </xsl:template> </xsl:stylesheet>
